alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 3:55PM MST until August 23 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 354 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Camp Verde, Clarkdale, Verde Village, Bridgeport, Cornville, Middle Verde, Cottonwood, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Dead Horse Ranch State Park, Tuzigoot National Monument and Mingus Mountain Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 225. Interstate 17 between mile markers 285 and 291. State Route 89A between mile markers 350 and 361. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Spring Creek, West Clear Creek, Bitter Creek, Gaddis Wash, Beaver Creek, Cherry Creek, Blowout Creek, Grief Hill Wash, Oak Wash, Verde River, Coffee Creek and Oak Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
